Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Process Analysis: Step 1 (Initial Data Validation): Seems neutral. Automated checks for completeness/accuracy. No obvious bias source here... Step 5 (Final Decision): Effect: Those with the boost get better rates/terms.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE

Affinity bias: Favoring members of specific clubs (Highland Civic Darts Club). Opacity: The boost is hidden (not openly disclosed).

Name: Ethical or Moral Reasoning - PE
Text: Justifiable vs. Problematic: Justifiable (The Companys View): Risk mitigation? They claim community ties correlate with financial responsibility (though not proven). Business strategy: Focusing on a local market they understand better. Not illegal yet... Problematic (The Ethical/Fairness View): Proxy Discrimination: Favoring local residents or specific clubs can be a proxy for race, ethnicity, or socioeconomic status... Transparency: Hidden adjustments are ethically dubious. Confirmation Bias in Humans (Step 4)...

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Implications of Favoring Non-Legally Protected Groups: Even if residency isnt protected, it often overlaps with national origin or race (disparate impact). It creates a chilling effect or market exclusion for outsiders. It undermines trust in the financial institution if discovered.
